meanings.definition: A curve or geometric figure, each part of which has the same statistical character as the whole.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a beautiful fractal using mathematical equations.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the intricate fractal patterns found in nature.
meanings.sent3: The children were amazed by the fractal on the computer screen.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a fractal, branching out into endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The fractal design mesmerized everyone with its repeating shapes.

meanings.definition: A complex geometric pattern exhibiting self-similarity in that small details of its structure viewed at any scale repeat elements of the overall pattern.
meanings.sent1: The snowflake's intricate fractal structure fascinated the students.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a computer program to generate a stunning fractal image.
meanings.sent3: The fractal pattern on the rug seemed to dance when you looked closely.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts formed a fractal of ideas, each connected to the next.
meanings.sent5: The city skyline at night resembled a glowing fractal of lights.
